detaileddescription.para:
The reading routine for a photon accepts as a first argumnet a pointer to a 64bit integer. The integer is processed by the reading routing and writes to the
The return value is true if the record is not an overflow record.

briefdescription.para: a vector containing the used routing channel numbers in the TTTR file
the number of time tagged data records in the TTTR file
the number of read time tagged data
the number of valid read records (excluded overflow and invalid records)

detaileddescription.para: Traverses the routing channel array and lists the used routing channel numbers in the protected attribute used_routing_channels.

Reads n_records records of the file (n_records is the number of records)
n_rec
is the number of records that are being read. If no number of records to be read is specified all records in the file are being read. If the parameter
rewind
is true (default behaviour) the file is read from the beginning of the records till the end of the file or till n_red records have been read. If
rewind
is false the records are being read from the current location of the file pointer till the end of the file.
Reads the TTTR data contained in a file into the TTTR object

simplesect.para: Returns 1 in case the file was read without errors. Otherwise 0 is returned.

detaileddescription.para: Returns an array containing the routing channel numbers that are contained (used) in the TTTR file.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the number of elements in the output array

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the number of elements in the output array

detaileddescription.para: Returns an array containing the routing channel numbers of the valid TTTR events.
